The gardens are situated at the end of the old town.There is a steep walk to reach them but it is well worth it.The view back down to the town is fantastic.The gardens are very nice and very well maintained with lots of colour and variety.There are plenty of places to relax and

If youre in Bern as a tourist and looking for a good spot to have a good dinner or beer with a very impressive view then thats the place to be. The restaurant itself is very nice but its clearly the view over the entire old town of Bern surrounded by the famous river Aare that
Lots of families picnicking, scenic and serene environment. Easy to reach by public transport. Great experience there.
The view is worth it. The incline up is quite a work out. Be ready for a cobbled up hill walk. Roses along the path are quite nice too.

Go here if you have kids or want to just chill with friends. Gorgeous setting over looking the city. If it's a hot day, get there early as the shady spots are snatched up quick. Not a bad spot to hang out solo, but you may feel left out as it's a very social environment,

As avid walkers, we walked up to the Rosengarten, on the advice of a dear friend, who said that this was her favourite spot in Bern, and we were not disappointed. Despite the heat, the flowers were still in bloom and the purple flowers impressed me most. The view of the city

It's a nice garden with different roses. Place to relax and have great view of city. Next to a restaurant with nice seatings outside relaxing. Not a lot of roses. It was nice but I was hoping to see more and different roses.

A free bus will take you from downtown to the Rose Garden. Many varieties of Roses are on disp0lay in many colors. There are park benches if you want to people watch or look at flowers. Couples as we'll as families frequent the rose garden.

This is an excellent green lung in Bern on the other side of River Aare. The climb to reach the garden is quite arduous, but you will be rewarded with a rosy atmosphere at the top plus an unforgettable view of Bern Old Town.

There are roses here and there are many types of them but, in July, they'd gone over a little bit and weren't at their best by far. It is still worth a visit though as the view of the city is spectacular and it's a nice place to spend some time a little bit out of the way. It's
Food was very good, offered a lot of outdoor dining spaces. It gets crowded though as one would expect at a place that is this beautiful. Make reservations, they are a must.
A MUST see when in Bern. Wonderful flowers and when you walk towards the city, you have stunning views over the old city center

Right next to the bear pit, is a steep 40 degree climb to the rose garden. Frankly the roses were no good( I have better rose shrubs in my backyard) but the views from the rose garden are the best in the city and its free ! Good place to chill and watch the sunset. Tip: Carry

This park is beautiful - roses of different kinds everywhere, nice lawns, children's playgrounds, and a restaurant. It also provides a great view of the city - I highly recommend going there. Take bus 40.
Nice quiet place for relax and leisure. Suitable for all ages. Wonderful garden with many different kind of roses. Nice view of the old town of Bern. Also has a restaurant.
To visit Rose Garden is really easy only catch a bus from downtown and it will go straight to the garden. Rose Garden is the place you must visit because it will shows you the great view of Bern.
For couples or families, food is decent, service polite, bring your camera.. enjoyed the well manicured rose garden, a touch of England in Bern I would say, have fun..
Beautiful views from the rose garden overlooking Bern. For those with younger kids, there is a neat park there for them to take a break from walking, and play. Worth the short climb up the hill.

Nice place to go sip a drink in Spring & Summer and enjoying an amazing view of Bern City in the same time. Chose a sunny day to go there. You can take a walk around the yard and contemplate the different type of roses. Romantic place.
From here you will have the perfect view of the old town of Bern! Spectacular pictures are guaranteed.
It was a little big for our 1.5 year old but she still found stuff to do. Nice and shady. Great view of old town and a cafe right beside the park as well. Didn't really look as the roses much!

The roses were in full bloom when we went in June and the sun was out (apparently a rarity) !! It's a small park but worth the walk out of the city. You can see the entire city from above even the teenagers enjoyed it

Definitely a place to relax and enjoy the view. You can buy a local beer at the take away corner or even better buy ot cheaper in a shop in the city and enjoy it there. Great garden and benches to chill around.
The Rose Garden is located at the top of a hill and the access path is very steep but once you get there, it is filled with colors and beautiful flowers everywhere. A nice stop.

We visited this garden on top of a steep hill on a clear, sunny day and the views of Bern were gorgeous at the summit. Lovely gardens - only a few roses in bloom but we saw azaleas and other colorful blooms as well as a reflecting pool and fountain. The outdoor cafe was

Unfortunately we came at the wrong time since most of the roses were not bloomed but we still enjoyed a stroll through the garden. It is absolutely perfect place to have a picnic or just read a book. One of those escapes from the busy city kind of atmosphere.
Worth the short trek up to the top especially on a sunny clear day. Stunning views of Bern and surrounding. The garden itself is beautiful too.
No roses in late May. However there are beautiful views over the city. And the garden is close to the Bear park. I am sure it is lovely when the roses are in bloom. Free entrance.

Guess it was pretty early to visit a rose garden in Switzerland at end May and that's what this garden is all about. It was very busy on a sunny Sunday with locals so is obviously an institution. It's easy enough to get up to via bus no 10 - about 15 minutes from the old town.

Loved this place. It is located very close to the Old Town and the Bear Park. There are signs indicating where it is, you just need to go up a hill. It is not very tiring but steep. When arriving there, you will be delighted with the beautiful view of Bern! It is not only a
The Rose Garden is an excellent place for many reasons. Good views over the City to the mountains. Good place to eat. Good place just to sit. Play area for kids. And... even some roses too.

We walked up to the rose garden along a pretty path behind our hotel The Landhaus. The path zigzags it's way up so we didn't find it too challenging. As it was October when we visited, most of the roses blooms had finished. But the best part of this garden is the view. The

The stunning view of the old town of Bern is amazing. You can go there with your children or friends have a nice picnic on the green and let them play with the "dragon" in the play ground but be careful (good balance is required) since climbing the dragon may be tricky. If you

Would highly recommend a good walk around the roses and rhododendrons when we visited. Tadpoles in the ponds too. Plenty of benches to sit and also other chairs and tables if you choose to picnic. Great views out over the river and City. Tranquil and peaceful and there is no

Our friend drove us to Rose Garden in a very nice evening to enjoy the sunset, Wow this park is so beautiful, lots of flowers, and a breathtaking view of Bern, around there is a nice restaurant with a patio, a very nice place to have a drink while enjoying the view. It is also a

This small park and gardens whilst being very pretty and having a lovely restaurant is mainly worth a visit for the stunning view it affords of the old town of Bern. Catch the tram up to it and walk down from the Rose Garden

This is such a nice place of the City of Berne! You have the best view of the oldtown, surrounded by the river, lovely to take some amazing Pictures. But the garden itself is something too, you have this beautiful roses, with their Storys, as far as you are interested. There is

Lovely open spaces, great view of the City on a clear Summers day. But, unfortunately, I would not partake of the food in the Restaurant. It is more like McDonalds in New York, than Maxims in Paris; and costs about the same as Paris.

On a steep hill, the Rosengarten is a peaceful park which has a magnificent view of the Old Town of Bern! You can go there conveniently by bus from the main train station, but pick a nice day without rain!
Rosengarden itself is not breathtaking - maybe when the roses are blooming - but from the edge one has the best view to the River and the old town of Berne
We visited in April before many flowers were out, but still a nice visit for free. It is a nice view worth a few pics. Doesn't take long at this time of year

The garden consisting of hundreds of different types of roses is gorgeous indeed. It is very clean and taken good care of. It is situated on a hill where local people like to gather with their friends and watch the sunset, talking and eating pizza. The atmoshpere is peaceful and
we went the first thing in the morning. it was nice stroll inside and had a beautiful view of Bern from the top!!

You definitely get the best view on the old town of bern. It's a place where you can sit, enjoy the sun and just enjoy the view for a long time. You don't even need someone to talk to..;) Another plus that i really apreciate is,that you can take away the coffees of the
Came for the views of Bern. It was spring and daffodils were blooming. Too early for roses. Nice grassy areas to let kids run.

The gardens have one of the best views over Bern that I have seen. There is a children's play area and a pond. The flowers were not out when we visited but I think it would look even better in the summer. There is a restaurant selling expensive coffee but you can use the
A lot is made of the Rose Garden in brochures etc. It was nice but much smaller then we thought. Its quite a hike and we had seen everything in about 10 minutes.
Always worth a visit because of the unique view of the old town. Also good for piquenique, particularly after winter when the first flowers are out. Dispute it's name, there is more than just roses!
Delightful foray. See the entire city. Beautiful views. Great for taking pics of the city and the river.
Even though it was almost winter, the Rose Garden is a beautiful sight and has a great view of Bern from the top of a hill.

Bern is such a compact city the best way to enjoy it is to walk. On our first day we set off from our accommodation at Wild Rose Guest House for the short walk to the Zytglogge, the famous ornate clock tower and on along Kramgasse the medieval street with elegant covered arcades

It's not big but it is worth a walk around if you have the time. The view is spectacular. We had a coffee while the kids played at the playground and enjoyed a quiet Sunday morning overlooking the town.

You can make a great walking trail from the garden to Barengraben (bear kit), then to Nudegg District and the old city in only 1 hour. The Rose Garden is a park with a wonderful view of the Old Town and Aare Loop. The park is home to 220 different types of roses, 200 types of

The view from the Rose Garden is very nice. Every traveler should go to see it. The view to the city is nice every time. In the night and in the day, doesn't matter how the weather is. It's even nice when it rains. The roses are quite spectacular too. There are many different

The Rose Garden is quite a hike from the Old Town of Bern, but it's worth every step! Do come during spring or summer. It's lovely seeing the town in full bloom. It's a free garden and there's a nice café as well, or you could bring your own supplies with you and have a picnic
Its one of the most popular tourist spots and deservingly so, lots of green to walk around or just laze on a sunny day with great views of the city and old town and river.
Is a perfect place for relaxing and have a nice view to the old part from the city. Also nice by sunrise.

Took the free tram up the hill to the rose garden (none in November of course) There had been a dusting of snow during the night and the whole city below was bathed in a white carpet. Had a few moments alone before the tourists arrived. And the tranquility was marvelous
This is a free park. i went in February so there is nothing much to see. I can imagine that the place to be spectacular when the flowers are in full bloom.

the garden is very nice, especially in spring and summer. But the best of all is the view on the old town of Bern. A nice restaurant for eating and drinking and a playground for the kids. Perfect for singles, couples and families.

The Rose garden is not only a very beautiful garden on its own, but it also provides the most amazing views of Bern as It is located at a high level than the city. Its a great place to relax and enjoy the view.
Walk from the bear pit park. Hike to rose garden for top view of old town Bern. See Bern from top and enjoy the rooftops and churches that deck the city capital
Nice park with a pub to enjoy a cold drink with a nice view on the city of Bern. Easy access by bus from the city center.

We were very lucky to walk in that little park on the hill around the riven. The Bern's view from that spot is something you will never forget. The snow, the lights, the time, the river, the city... all in perfect position for a picture to remember!

I was not a fan of roses before to go there. But the diversity of colors and parfums, their funny names, the way in which all the garden is arranged so that you can have enough space to admire all type of roses and even smell them, conquered my heart and made me see the roses in
We were there during the February so did not see the roses at all, but still it was beautiful. You can rest your eyes there :)

A great family space with lawns, fountains and of course many varieties of roses. Probably the best view of Bern's old town and a great place to share a cappuccino served up indoors or out by the friendly Rose Garden Cafe staff. It's just up the hill from Bern's famous Bären

There are quite a few famous photos of Bern covered in snow or with the sun going down. they are taken from just above the Old Town from the Rose Gardens. Head up on a Sunny afternoon and let the sunset fade before heading back into town for dinner and a drink. If its warm

We went in winter when the roses were not in bloom. The scenery was still fantastic of course and we could have a nice panoramic view of the river, bridges and the city.

Although I was there during the winter time, I could tell it would be a charming place when the flora is in full bloom. Was there during late afternoon and early evening and saw the sun setting over Bern and it was just beautiful. Recommend making it a stop either to or from the

We went there in December, so no roses! It was crowded with almost all visitors to Bern wanting to go there. Prepare for a difficult and steep climb up. We wanted to come there in summer or spring to see roses as well as the morning view.
People love hanging out here, drinking beer and having barbiques. The view over Bern is fantastic and the roses and other parts of nature are very romantic. Worth visiting!

We visited in winter so of course there were no flowers. However, this is a nice walk up a long hill which was a great way to burn off some of the pretzel and beer calories consumed. Also, this is the bast place for an overall view of this beautiful city. Take your camera!
Whenever you visit Bern, this is the fenomenal place to visit. It makes you fill comfortable and happy. The view is wonderful and colors are amazing.

1. The view from there is the best you can get in town 2. If you like flowers you will be impressed by the endless colors and variety of roses 3. In summer you can have a nice dinner at one of the outside tables of the excellent restaurant, while you keep an eye to your children
Perfect location to look over Bern and visit the Rosengarten restaurant. In summer nice to relax and a good city atmosphere.

Rose Garden is a lovely public garden just outside of berne's old town with a wonderful view on all major public sights of the city as mount gurten, bear park, münster church and the house of parliament. There is also a nice restaurant with a huge outside terrace in the rose

We visited Rosengarden in August. It was beautiful place and was easy to to go just by walking (could have also use a bus but we didn't use, we walked since it was pretty near). The place is high above the city so the view is really nice. I could say you can see almost whole
Very nice place to visit in the summer. Great view of the city and just a very peaceful place to relax for an afternoon, early evening.

We visited Rosengarten in November 2015. The site was easily accessible by bus from the city centre. Beautiful roses in neatly organised rows and really nice view of the city. Locals come here to chill out and relax with their friends and families.

I visited the Rose Garden in November first week when fall had set in and the garden was beautiful shades of yellows green oranges and reds. There were very few roses per se. The highlight was the view from RosenGarten, it was super!

Bern is a pretty little city, very near to Zurich (it takes about 1 hour by train, very convenient). Rose garden is beautiful with variety of roses and wide ground. It is peaceful to relax. And the walking road to go there is so beautiful, you have wonderful views of old Bern
they have more than 150 variety of roses. very beautiful. located near lake Zurich... lovely place to visit

Although there are many beautiful flowers here, this garden is mostly known for its great views. The view over the town is worth the walk if the weather is good, therefore be sure you deserve time to sit, drink something and enjoy the moment while you're there.
Nice view of the old city of Bern.How the name says there is a rosegarden and a big playground for kids and a restaurant.U have a nice view of the bärenpark and nydegg Bridge.

A great place to admire the view You don’t need to walk from downtown you just take the bus that will take you to the entrance of the Garden. Is a peaceful place where you can grab a cup of coffee or tea :) we loved it there
There are good views across the city and the park is peaceful. There is a good restaurant to eat in. But I wouldn´t come here especially if you are pressed for time.
Even in the winter when the splendor of the blooming roses isn`t visible, the view over the old town is a treat to hungry tourists` eyes!
Wander around and soak in the view. Treat yourself to a coffee from the lovely cafe. Easy to walk up to or take the great public transport system
Either having breakfast, coming for a picnic, or seeing the sunset in the evening, it is a great place here.

I didn't dine in the restaurant. It's a steep walk up but the view is really worth it. Many people just sat in the sun to mingle, picnic etc. Really liked the view of Bern from the Rose garden. Do walk up.
It was autumn so, not much roses but still very beautiful. Worth going as you can see the old town by the River Aare from the top. Good spot for photo taking

A local shop owner recommended that we check out the Rose Garden and pointed us int he right direction. It was quite a little trek up the path, but when you get to the top, the views are breathtaking! There is a little cafe at the top as well and a lovely little park. I
Nice cozy place to spend a whole day enjoying the view over old town Bern and the river Aare. Place ideal for family gathering. Place for all generations.

rose garden is placed on a small heel across bern. this allows you to see the panorama of bern. the view from here is stunning. from the other side there is a big park with a lot of various sorts of roses. you can see roses in all sizes and shapes, while you are walking around
The roses are beautiful but the view of the city is spectacular. This is a great place to take pictures of the city with the mountains behind it.
It has a nice restaurant and a small library in the park. My child (5 yrs) loves the play ground. The view over Bern is fantastic.

Took the bus to the garden. It's breathtaking . You get to see whole bern from above. We arrived there before sunset so you can imagine the view. There is a playground for kids and a restaurant. Didn't try the restaurant so can't comment on that.
We visited the Rose Garden with a group tour. The flowers were beautiful and I was amazed they were still blooming in September! The view of the town at the overlook was awesome.

For tourists a must, though for older people; beware, there is quite a climb. In Spring and Summer there are hundreds of different rose species to look upon and smell. I wouldn't necessarily eat at the restaurant though, as beautiful as the view is, it is better to go enjoy the
From the old town go across the river and walk slowly uphill for about 5 minutes. There you have a great view of Bern.
A bit of a climb but on a clear day a super place to rest, eat and admire the city view. Although October there were still some roses in flower
The visit to the rose garden really worth it. Besides seeing many different colored roses, you can enjoy the wonderful view of the city.

We were feeling rather tired after walking through the old town when we decided to take the bus to the view point through rosengarten. That was a very good decision. We arrived at this garden that has rose beds throughout the park. We wlalked through to the view point. Fantastic

Top location. Famous on it's Roses. During the Summer time, it is perfect for picnic or meet ups with family and friends. The view of Bern's Old City fascinate mostly of the visitors. It has as well restaurant and playground for the children. I like as well during the Cherry

This is truly spectacular rose garden, but pardon the expression - the view really gilds the lily. The panoramic view is quite breathtaking. The adjacent playground made me wish I were a kid again so I could climb around on it with my friends.
I was taking here as a guest a few times - beautiful food and wine with breathtaking views of Bern. Excellent service and ambience.

While the rose garden itself will most certainly not blow you away, it's still a nice place to go. Chairs can be dragged to the shade plus there are some fountains that make it a relaxing place on a hot summer day. The view of old town ("Altstadt") from the rose garden is hard

I highly recommend going when its not busy. It was a pretty hot day when I visited and I loved it. If you love taking photos...its a great place to experiment with your camera. There is a restaurant overlooking the old town and river and a beautiful park for a picnic with

The Rose Garden occupies a large are uphill and is definitely a vantage point for overlooking the Old Town apart from viewing beautiful roses while in bloom. At leisure, you can have a cup of tea in the cafe inside the garden while watching others walking around with children
A beautiful and peacefull place to admire the old Bern. Nice photo opportunities from there. The garden itself is very well maintain. Just few hundreds meters from the bears enclosure

This garden is well maintained and the flowers are beautiful. It has a restaurant in the garden and there was a wedding banquet going on while I was there. It had a nice view of Bern!! It is a must visit point of interests in Bern.

Great view of Bern & Aare curve. Disappointing gardens but neat variety of flowers. Ideal fountain but not as nicely maintained as you would expect for Switzerland. Quite a hike up from Bear Pit but easy access from Ostermundigen side. Fancy restaurant w/ great service but make

A really popular restaurant with wonderful view over Bern. You really must make a reservation or miss out. We ate a very good Rogan Josh and a beef carpaccio while enjoying the scenery and listening to the town bells tolling.
a nice place to chill. Great view of the city Bern. With a restaurant up there that serves nice food.

This Park & Restaurant is the Best Place for Sunset Dinner on a summer evening overlooking the City of Bern. It is worth arriving early to spend some time before dinner in the Beautiful adjacent Park & Rose Gardens... Then have a a table at the open windows for a Fantastic
You have a nice view of Bern here and the roses are amazing, just watch out in which season you are to avoid any bad surprise cause the flowers aren't in all seasons

This place is a must! Most pictures you see of Bern are either taken from a helicopter or from Rosengarten. It is also a nice park to spend a day off or evening. If you go there in the morning you have the city in the morning sun, in the evening you have a nice sunset. Be aware
You can enjoy great sunshine and good view over there. Many people have picnics there. Quite comfortable.
Nice park with a great overview of Bern. Best place for sunset and to go afterwards to the Tram Depot for dinner and a selfmade beer.
The Rose Garden is a hidden treasure in Bern. The garden is beautiful and is located on a hill that provides amazing views of old town Bern!
It is well worth a walk up for the views alone (not in 34°c heat as we did ) .The rose gardens are nice but not the finest you colud see also they seemed a little poorly kept.

The restaurant is not cheap and the service is just over "ok" but the views are stunning and the salads make up for it. Next to the seating area is a playground for children, which is great for families with children up to 8-9 years.

Almost skipped this place but thankfully I did not do so. The garden is beautifully decorated with different types of roses and flowers. There is lots of space to have picnics or just to simply laze around. Alternatively, you can visit the restaurant there where you can chill

We came here in late July and although there were some flowers many of them had wilted and died (maybe due to the recent heat wave). The garden also has a nice view overlooking the old town. Be prepared to take a steep walk up or alternatively you could get the bus.

It's a steep climb up to the Rosengarten from the old bear pit but the views are worth it. Good panorama of the city and nice gardens to sit in. There's also a restaurant too which looks out across the city.

My wife and I visited the Rosengarten in early July. Its a moderately steep climb up to the Rose garden, but once there, it is all worth it. There are fantastic views of Bern on the hill. The gardens are a very tranquil place to visit and re-charge your batteries. We had a late

Great place for a piknik. Well worth the hike up the hill. If you cannot walk take the bus nr 10. Service in the restaurant is sloooooow so don't go there if you're in a hurry.
Go there in the beginning of summer as the Roses have flowers! The restaurant there is also a good place to have the daydish. Do not forget to reserve before... the place is crowded!
Although just a few roses when I visited but it's a nice garden to relax. (provided that the weather is good.)
Good view of Bern, but just a small garden with not many roses (we definitely expected more roses considering that's the park's name).
if you are touring Bern and the weather is good get over to this park.I arrived on sunday when there was a live piano concert in the middle of the park, hundreds of people sitting in a big circle.

Perfect spot to meet friends and family (also with kids, as there us a big playground) or for a romantic date. You can walk around and learn the names of the various roses, enjoy the view on the old town or just sit in the shadow. If you are hungry you can bring your own picnic.

The attraction is the view of the old Bern town from the Rose garden, with the river winding around it. Take in the view, snap a photo, and take a walk downhill towards the town for your next sightseeing

As I was in Switzerland this winter with some friends, we decided to visit one of the most famous places in the capital of Switzerland, Bern. It's a georgeous garden named Rosengarten or Rose Garden. This garden is in the old part of the town. It was redesigned many times and it
nice view and worth to take a little time to go up there, some place was peaceful esp for the bern view. love it.

Great variety of roses. A great place for family or couples to relax and have a wonderful view of the Bern city. Also a wonderful place for taking photos. Kids would love the playground. It's just up the slope from the Bear pit and the Altes Tramdepot restaurant.
I went there on a sunny day. I have some drinks at tea time. People can have a great view of the Bern city at this garden. The rose itself is not attractive to me.
The variety and number of roses was amazing. They were stunning and well cared for . The views of and from the garden make this a great little stop on a visit to Bern.
Nice and relaxing with a gorgeus view. Highly recommended walk. Do not forget to bring with you a nice camera.

Sitting on the wall, looking at the sun go down over Bern, life could be worse! This cute park is a perfect place to sit with a few beers and enjoy the sunshine. The large open grass spaces are great for playing on, with well maintained lawns and neat flower borders. Great
This gives us a nice view of the whole city. There are nice flowers there and a grass patch for picnics.
High up on a hill, the rose garden gives you a great view of the sites of Bern. The climb is tough but worth it for the view. The garden is well kept and was in high bloom towards the end of June.

Heading there in a sunny day when you can enjoy the view from the top. The garden itself very beautiful and clean. You can find many kind of flowers with little signs which state their names, which was very helpful recognize them -brilliant. Heading there just after the bear
Went to there on the head of May, still cold, no flower at that season. But there are a Panorama view point to see the whole old town city of Bern, Amazing and very relax place.
i got off here and spend a bit of time relaxing but the highlight is the view of the city you get its amazing and you see all the attractions

5 Minutes walk from the bear pit, you will have a wonderful view over the old town of Bern. Young people meet here to have a picnic or watch the sunset. Come here if you are looking for a nice place to chill after a busy day. There is also a good restaurant in the parc, altough

This short but uphill walk is essential if you want to see a great view of the entire old city. The rosengarten is filled with amazing roses, fountains, and play areas for the kids. A touristy restaurant is there as well that has a great view from the inside. This walk is a

If you want to capture a nice picture of the whole Bern city, you should come to Rosengarten. Breathtaking views from up above! Only a short walk from my Hotel Alpenblick. However, I was a little disappointed to find out that not many flowers on display, let alone my favorite

First off did you know that if you wanted to take in the views of the old city of Bern from a high viewpoint the terrace at Rosengarten would be the best (I think)? At least it is accessible by foot and bus, and free of charge. It was worth the climb from the Bear Garden site.

Vantage location of this very well maintained garden overlooking the historic city of Berne. Great place to relax with family, specially when the Sun is out. You can get your drinks at the small cafe at the top. Kids enjoy the swings and also some sand pits..
Beautiful, a lot of different roses. Nice view to see the old city of Bern. Good place to spend time with family and friends.

Took tram no.10 and reached Rose Garden. Very beautiful and well maintained garden with many colors and varieties of flowers. Awesome view of the old town, St. Cathedral etc. Many people come here with their families and spend the day as a picnic day. They have few rides for the
Worth the walk to the top to see the city below looking as pretty as a postcard. Nice gardens and very peaceful spot to relax.

when we went there on the 4th week of April, the flowers were not blooming yet, but the city view of Bern was fantastic. There's tourist information office in front of the bust stop, and you can get any info you want. You have to go uphill to Rosengarten..
Quick tram ride from centre brings you to a very pleasant garden area overlooking the city. Lots of visitors as weather very warm for May. Would like to go back when more flowers are in bloom
Free entry. Easy to get to...we walked. Slight hill at the start but OK. You go there for the views of the old town. Check out the garden.
Walked there today, beautiful colours. Great view over Bern, it was very nice. Nice grassed area to sit and it was well kept.

Well kept and full of colour ( in May anyway) . Very peaceful as the Swiss are a wonderfully considerate people ( no mobile phones conversation , well behaved children ) . Good views over the town and a lovely restaurant where you can just buy a beer or a drink if you like. Can
The place is great as it is. But I know must be much better when the roses are in full bloom. Maybe not the best time to visit in May.
Beautiful flowers but maybe more beautiful if the roses are already in bloom because when we visited, no flowers yet. The views down are really fantastic from the Rosengarten.
everything was breathtaking! happy youngsters perfect location hours of enjoyment may go on forever Perhaps not enough seats or benches

Must visit, especially in summers. This garden is kind of on top of the city of Bern, so you get to see beautiful panorama of the city along with breathtaking variety of Roses.

I love the feelings of walking from the old town of bern up to this rose garden by crossing the bridge. Its a mixed feelings so i can think of and come up into my mind. When up on the top of the rose garden its really beautiful view of Bern old town with river and with

Innovative Swiss menu, offered by attentive servers, great setting offering wonderful views of Bern, set in a hilltop park! Great soups, Salads and pasta entrees. Outdoor dinning is also offered. A must for your first trip to Bern!

Nice challenge... especially if you r not working out :D :P It is placed on the top of a little hill... so you must breathe deep, smog your forces and don't give up on the half of the way on those benche's.... the view from up there is worth every drop of sweat :)

I love roses and gardens so this place was for me. It smelled amazing and the roses were so beautiful. If you like that kind of thing, this was a great place. It's at the top of a hill and it was a long walk up but there were great views all along the way and a spectacular view

Although not in flower during our visit, one could see by the planting arrangements that it would be quite a site when the roses were in full bloom. It's other main feature is the view from the garden back across the river to the "Old Town". Magnificent.

We walked up to the Rose Garden and the view of Bern was definitely worth the trip uphill. Try to go up on a clearer day. You can visit this and the Bear park on the same short walk. A definite must if you go to Bern!

Thankfully close to many other major attractions such as the bear pit, this beautiful garden is a great place to have lunch or just to relax for a while. Beautiful views make it a great photo spot, very peaceful.

This is well worth the uphill trek, the views are unbelievable! Going in autumn was great- the paths were covered in leaves and everything looked so picture perfect! But the downfall is there weren't many roses in bloom. There is one cafe at the top which doesn't have much

text.wiki:
The Gurten is a mountain situated just to the south of Bern, the capital city of Switzerland. It is 858 metres (2,815 ft) high, and the summit yields views of Bern, of the Jura mountains and of the Alps.Facilities on the Gurten include a hotel, restaurants, a 25-metre-high (82 ft) viewing tower and a children's playground. Winter sports facilities are available in winter. The Gurtenfestival, a music festival, is held every year in the middle of July.The Gurten is accessible on foot, or by the Gurten Funicular from Wabern. Wabern can itself be reached from central Bern by tram, train or car. Wabern bei Bern station, on lines S3 and S31 of the Bern S-Bahn, is adjacent to the lower station of the funicular, as is the Gurtenbahn stop on Bern tramway route 9.

The castle site of Aegerten lies a good 1 kilometre (0.62 mi) to the south-east of the Gurten summit. The remains consists of a roundish castle hill, which formerly carried a rectangular donjon, surrounded on three sides by a wall and rench.


== See also ==

A nice place to stay ... a great view. The park is very big and good for hours of walk. The nearby selfservice restaurant has a perfect view over Bern.

My kids always love to visit the Gurten when we are in Bern. You have to take a bus from the train station and then walk up a hill to get there. Once there, you have to buy a funicular pass to get to the Gurten. All of these steps make it quite difficult to get to, but if you

You take the cable car up the mountain and then you can walk around at the top. Great views plus an observation tower. With curiosity, you can hike down into a neighborhood and find public transit back to town. Nice views on a clear day. Plus food and activities are available.

To get to Gurten you must catch a tram to the Gurten Bahn stop and ride the funicular up the side of the 'mountain'. You are rewarded with a decent view of the city of Bern, best viewed from Gurten Hotel terrace where the drinks are not too badly priced (for Switzerland). You
The Gurten is fantastic for families and has a wonderful view of the city! Sunday brunch is really sonething special rain or shine!!!
This is a view of Bern and its suburbs. Great little restaurant at the top of the mountain will you come sit and enjoy a bottle of Chardonnay over looking Bern.

Great weather and beautiful place where families, couples and friends can hang out! Hidden from tourist crowds and perfect place for picnic over green grass or just hanging around for a lazy brunch at their terrace restaurant

This berner mountain is a great place to hike for a few minutes, it offers awesome views of the Aare valley and the city in every season, but it can get VERY foggy during the winter. Go up with the cable car or by foot and enjoy a coffee from the restaurant with some pastry
Check the timings for the funicular that goes to Gurten. Its a nice spot for a romantic picnic and a walk in open fields with views of the entire city.

Easily accessible with kids. They enjoyed the funicular and the Migros play station. The walking trails are simple and the park is beautiful. The views of the city is good. A family picnic is a great option in summer

Spotted this as a good place to go with kids when researching things to do on our Bern weekend away. SO glad when went. Easy transport on a Sunday morning via the number 9 tram. A sort walk around the corner (follow everyone else!) to the funicular and straight up the mountain.
Nice park where you can walk around and enjoy the view. it is also en easy walk down instead of taking the cable car.

This is the Bern house-mountain. Well, really just a hill but what a hill. There is everything for kids - great playgrounds, a little train, things to climb on, slides to slide on and chicken nuggets, too! Lovely view of Bern from here and quick food to a very nice restaurant
Lots of opportunities to walk in a quiet atmosphere. Brilliant facilities for children. Good views over the city
We had visited gurten in feb when we had heavy snow and spent quite good time. The view from gurten is beautiful

Easy to get to by team and cable car only takes about 10 mins to get to the top. It's peaceful and quiet, not much to do but the view is lovely. Nice place to have a bite to eat and a drink

Good restaurant, good wines. I have been here several times with customers, colleges and friends and each time we had a very nice evening and a good view over the city!

Beautiful place, great views! Great little play area, our son also enjoyed the miniature train and cars which were fairly priced. The restaurant is buffet style and you pay for the weight of your food. You can walk up and down if you wish or take the easy route up in the train.

We absolutely loved the trip to the Gurten. The funicular ride was so much fun and the views were amazing. We walked down the hill to see the snow covered trees and up the hill to get great views of the Alps. Everything was so picturesque! (See photos). We had lunch and a bit of

Gürten is a little hideaway just few mins away from the city of Bern. You take Tram 9 and get off at Gürtenbahn station. From there you take another ride with a cable car going to the top. Or when the weather is fine, take a walk. It will only take you an hour approximately.

I have been for a walk here during summer and it is a lovely way to spend an afternoon, but in winter it is beautiful. Sunny with snow decorating all the trees and fog blanketing the valleys that are Bern. It was a most unforgettable experience.

What a park! It seems like it's a great place to visit on any clear day. We went in December. While it was cold, it was manageable because we were constantly moving—which we had to do if we wanted to see more than just a small area of the park. We had gorgeous views of Bern's
Quiet and covered with snow at the time we visit. Though the Gurten Park not opened, the whitish village is beautiful. Hope to go on another sunny day so as to watch the Alps mountain range!
Nice view, great place for kids, affordable restaurant. Use the cable car up and walk down. In the summer theere is a festival there; great concert arena!

The equivalent of a North American style national park, Gurten boasts splendid views of the mountains and city with a host of well-maintained trails for biking, walking (and even sledding!). A quick and easy trip from the Old City, this is a worthwhile stop while in Bern.

Use your free travel pass you receive when you stay in an official accommodation and travel up to the Gurten. Do a round walk, enjoy the view and charge up your energy inside or outside the beautiful Migros self-service restaurant.

It is a nice hill that gives a view for entire Bern city. It is well maintained, has a good restaurant as well, a view tower that allows you to see Alps in the good weather conditions. There is a cable car that allows to get to Gurten quickly. There are plenty of kids

We go here for several times, and it's always perfect. They have soooo many play areas for baby, toddler, and for us too. They have instagram-able areas too, electric cars, resto, free picnic area for grill time, etc. Super recommended place, for any season!
Great outdoor location for families with young kids, couples or friends. Whether admiring the views, having some fine food or just exercising with your mountain bike or simply running.
Absolutely worth the trip. Our tram pass from the hotel included the fare to ride the funicular up the 900' to the top. Lovely to have an overview of the city and surrounds.

We toured the small town of Gurten and found it interesting. We were using Rick Steve's guide book and that helped us find some of the more unique sites. The view of the lake and the roof tops and chimneys are wonderful. We toured this old town in about an hour.

Perfect in good weather for green space, and views of the city to one side, and the mountains to the other. Lots of recreational opportunities -- we walked, barbecued and would have spent a long time at the play area if we'd had more time!

Came up here for a great hike, lookout and picnic. It also has one of the coolest childrens attractions that I have ever seen; a Rune Goldberg like device that moves coloured balls around a series of obstacles.

Big playgrounds - attractions - several restaurants - bike and walking trails - nice view. Best place for families with kids in all age. Also nice to go in winter.

Great place. Very good food, impeccable service, also it's a fun place to go, with the funicular, the views and everything.

A must do on any trip to Bern. Gorgeous park walks and city and mountain views. The only negative was that many of the restaurants were closed or had sold out of food, at 4pm we were hoping for a drink and a light snack which was hard.

On the city of Bern. Take the time and walk up the mountain, passing "Gurtendörfli". It takes about 45min and is much better than taking the expensive train. It is great both day- and nighttime; best is to get there in daylight and have a beer or two until it's dark and the view

The Gurten provide a good panoramic view of Bern city. There is a tram that will take you to the top. The tram ride is included in the Bern Pass (public transport pass). You can picnic here during warmer months. gets quite cold during winter

We went up the Gurten by train for the 1st August 2014 and the fireworks were awesome. There were bars and music also, it was a nice day. The view from there is beautiful, and the restaurants and the hotels look amazing.

This mountain park is very easy to get to from central Berne and offers stunning views, walks and restaurant. Stunning when snow covered.

An easy ride on the city train (they call it a tram) gets you to the base of the Gurtenbahn funiculaire, and you can buy tickets to ride it or do the steep hike up to the top of Gurten Mountain. Many people and cyclists take the funiculaire to the top and walk or ride down, but

We had lunch on Sunday in the restaurant of the Gurten Hotel overlooking Bern. Food was great, service very friendly and the views over Berne phantastic.

Nice short hiking and excellent views of the city of Bern, community of Köniz, the Alps and the Jura. A very nice hike up (40 minutes) is from 'Blinzern' the end stop of Bus 19 line. Best walk from the bottom station of the Gurtenbahn is the hiking trail via the Studholz

Really enjoyed going to the Gurten. Plenty of activities for family and enjoyable all year round. Favorite time to visit was right after first snowfall.

Went here with my friend who is a resident of Bern on his recommendation. Easy to get to on the tram no.9 and there is a cable car that takes you to summit of the hill which costs CHF6. The ride is short but worth it. At the top it is basically a giant park and open space at
the train take you fast on the top ,( walking is best and free in 1 hours you are there ) you can see diffrent views of Bern alps and city.

Amazing place to visit with kids. My son and me had a great time at Gurten. There are so many child friendly things to do.

Brilliant views from the top of the hill. Also loads to do for little ones so would definitely recommend if you have children. Ate at the restaurant up there too which was lovely. Lots of walks to suit all ages and abilities. On top of this, it's free to get the funicular up to
This is a beautiful spot to be sure, but don't go on a weekend. Way to crowded! I recommend a picnic lunch at the top on a nice day.

My first visit to city of Bern's mountain was very pleasant. The activities up there range from walking, biking, or simply enjoy the view. A convenient ride up with a cable car, also ok for prams, bicycles etc. the cable car bottom station is about 15 min. (By street car) Away

The view from the top of the mountain is just amazing - you can see over the hall capital and a lot further. The summit is easy accessible by the cable car or you can also walk to the top (around 1 hour) or take the bike.
Great for families with kids and nice views of Bern below. The mini train rides and playgrounds are perfect to keep kids entertained. The green hilly grass is a nice spot for a picnic.

Bern´s "Hausberg" - the hill in the middle of Bern. Nice short cablecar going up, easy walking down appr. 30 -45 min. On the hill playgrounds hiking trails, restaurants and a nice place to hangout!

What a beautiful getaway - and so close to the city center! The Gurten is where families gather. Great playgrounds, a miniature railway to ride on, enough space to play some soccer or frisbee. The self service restaurant Tapis Rouge boasts a great variety of food (buffet style).
Spent a Sunday afternoon up here sat in the lovely green space, reading a book. Lots of walks and places to eat, and some fantastic views of the mountains.

It's a little far from the city, but I strongly recommend you to visit it since you get to climb atop a tower where you could see miles away in a clear day. The entrance and train to the top is included if you have the SwissPass.

Took a short train ride to the top and had a lovely view of Bern. Also had lunch at the cafe which was lovely, albeit slightly expensive but this was expected. Only slight negative issue is that the staff running the train were not the most pleasant.

We took the funicular up to the top of Gurten and walked around the top of the hill. The view is very nice and there are lots of benches to sit down and enjoy it from. We spent a couple of hours here before returning to central Bern.

Bought bread, cheese and fruit from the Saturday farmers market in Old Town and took it up to Gurten. So enjoyable and fantastic views. A must do on anyone's list. Great for young children.

This is a trip you have to make if you are in Bern, especially in summer when the city center is so hot. You will have the best view on the city and will enjoy some fresh air as well. You reach there via a small funicular. Once on top, you will find a large and great green park

The Gurten park offers a good day out from the centre of Bern, only about 20 minutes away by tram. There are walking trails, a viewing tower to climb and other activities for children. The restaurants have great views of the city.

Good place to relax and soak in the view of Bern, not to mention cool air and plenty of green open spaces for a picnic

Takes you up to see all of Been. There's some big green fields up there that looks nice. Good for kids also there are some activities. You'll also get mountain bikers joining you as they have a trail that starts up top.

And the swiss Alps. Good brunch in the restaurant. Some nice dance events in the evening. Also good for kids to play

text.wiki:
The Waisenhausplatz (Orphanage Plaza) is a plaza in the Old City of Bern, the medieval city center of Bern, Switzerland.  It is on the edge of the Innere Neustadt which was built during the second expansion from 1255 to 1260, though the plaza was not built until later.  It is on the north of the peninsula, and divided from Bärenplatz by Marktgasse.  It is part of the UNESCO Cultural World Heritage Site that encompasses the Old City.


== History ==

Waisenhausplatz was first used to describe three formerly separate plazas in the 19th Century.  The southern portion (Nr. 2-14) was built over the ditch in front of the second city wall in the 16th Century.  Originally known as Viehmarkt (Cattle Market), then Holzmarkt (Wood Market), later as Weinplatz (Wine Plaza) and finally in the 18th and 19th Centuries as Schweinemarkt (Pork Market).  The middle section of Waisenhausplatz (Nr. 16-28) was also built over the protective ditch, the Tachnaglergraben, and was known as Zeughausplatz (Armory Plaza).  The northern section (Nr. 29/30) was built in 1784 and was always known as Waisenhausplatz.

The Reformed Nydeggkirche (from the Bernese German expression for "Lower corner") is located on the eastern edge of the Old City of Bern, in the Nydegg section.


== The castle Nydegg ==
The old town is situated on a peninsula in a loop of the Aare and developed in several expansion stages. The first occurred in 1191, as an existing settlement was expanded in the area of Nydeggkirche to the Clock Tower (Zytglogge).  In 1190 Duke Berchtold V von Zähringen had built the castle Nydegg.  After the extinction of the House of Zähringen, it came under the control of the city and was razed in 1266-73 by the inhabitants of Bern, in order to develop the Nydegg section. It possessed four corner towers and was located about where the current choir of the church stands.


== The Church ==

The original small church was built from 1341 to 1346 to replace the old fortress.  It was first sanctified in March 1344, followed by a second on 23 May 1346.  This early church featured a bell tower.  On 12 January 1469 the city asked the Teutonic Order to donate the Nydegg chapel to the Mary Magdalene Brotherhood and to allow them to use the money paid to the chapel to rebuild the building.  However, the city had to wait until the end of the Burgundian Wars (1472-1476) to begin the project. From 1480 to 1483 the city added a tower and from 1493 to 1504, a new nave was added.  After the Protestant Reformation in 1529, the Nydeggkirche was transformed into a warehouse for barrels, timber and grain, but in 1566 again served as worship space.  Beginning in 1566 it was cleaned out and minor renovations made to the windows and walls.  However, in 1568 the bell tower roof caught fire and was destroyed.  The new roof was finished and the damaged clock work repaired by the end of May 1571.  The large wrought iron cross which tops the main spire was built by Caspar Brükessel during the same time.  The current tower's appearance mostly dates back to the 1571 reconstruction.  The later changes to the tower were fairly minor.  For example, in 1625 four small embrasures or firing slits were broken out of the tower to help defend the city gate and in 1631 eight copper waterspouts were added to the roof.Until 1721 it was a branch church of the Münster of Bern. Today's congregation forms part of the Reformed Churches of the Canton Bern-Jura-Solothurn.
In 1863, the church was extended to the west and an entrance from the Nydeggbrücke (Nydegg Bridge) was added.  Then, from 1951 to 1953 a total renovation happened.  During the renovation, bronze reliefs by Marcel Perincioli were added to the main entrance at Nydegghöfli and the entrance to the bridge.
The Nydegghöflibrunnen or Stalden fountain was added to a niche under Nydegggasse at Nydegghöfli in 1857.  Then, in 1968, the Zähringer monument at Nydegghöfli was erected, which had previously been on the Munster platform.


== The bronze reliefs ==

In 1956, bronze reliefs by Perincioli were inspired by medieval role models in front of San Zeno in Verona and the Cathedral of Hildesheim.
On the main door, you can see scenes from the life and work of Jesus, on the left wing, from top to bottom:

The announcement of the birth of Jesus to the shepherds (Luke 2:8-14)
The baptism of Jesus (Mark 1:1-11)
Sermon on the Mount (Matthew 5-7)
The healing of a paralytic (Mark 2:1-12)and on the right wing:

The birth of Jesus in the stable at Bethlehem (Luke 2)
The temptation of Jesus (Mark 1:12 f.)
The miraculous feeding (Mark 6:30-44)
The Raising of Lazarus (John 11:17 ff)On the Brückentüre are on the left wing, from top to bottom are following scenes:

The women come to the grave of Jesus (Mark 16:1-8)
Jesus before Pontius Pilate (Mark 15:1-5)
The foot washing (John 13:1-20)
The anointing at Bethany (John 12:1-10)and on the right wing:

The risen Christ on the Sea of Galilee (John 21:1-14)
The burial of Jesus (John 19:38-42)
Jesus in Gethsemane (Mark 14:32-42)
The entrance to Jerusalem (John 12:12-19)


== Notable Pastors ==
Worked as a chaplain at the Nydeggkirche

Kurt Marti (from 1961 to 1983)On 8 July 1995, the pastor of Nydeggkirche, Bäumlin Klaus (born 1938), caused a media storm following his offering of a blessing service for same-sex couple for Stephan Diggelmann and Bareld Storm.

text.wiki:
Bernard (Bernhard) is a West Germanic masculine given name.The name is attested from at least the 9th century. West Germanic Bernhard is composed from the two elements bern "bear" and hard "brave, hardy". Its native Old English reflex was Beornheard, which was replaced by the Old French form Bernard after the Norman conquest.
The name Bernhard was notably popular among Old Frisian speakers.
Its wider use was popularized due to Saint Bernhard of Clairvaux (canonized 1174).


== Geographical distribution ==
As of 2014, 42.2% of all known bearers of the surname Bernard were residents of France (frequency 1:392), 12.5% of the United States (1:7,203), 7.0% of Haiti (1:382), 6.6% of Tanzania (1:1,961), 4.8% of Canada (1:1,896), 3.6% of Nigeria (1:12,221), 2.7% of Burundi (1:894), 1.9% of Belgium (1:1,500), 1.6% of Rwanda (1:1,745), 1.2% of Germany (1:16,397), 1.2% of Jamaica (1:595), 1.1% of Ghana (1:6,179), 1.0% of England (1:13,691) and 1.0% of Madagascar (1:6,098).
In France, the frequency of the surname was higher than national average (1:392) in the following regions:
1. Collectivity of Saint Martin (1:60)
2. Saint Barthélemy (1:189)
3. Bourgogne-Franche-Comté (1:260)
4. Nouvelle-Aquitaine (1:283)
5. Auvergne-Rhône-Alpes (1:296)
6. Brittany (1:333)
7. Pays de la Loire (1:336)
8. Provence-Alpes-Côte d'Azur (1:348)
9. Hauts-de-France (1:391)
